title: Wanda Nara claims Inter Milan missed Mauro Icardi's influence in loss to Juventus
text:
Wanda Nara aimed a less-than-subtle dig at Inter Milan by claiming Antonio Conte's side badly missed her husband Mauro Icardi in the Derby D'Italia defeat to Juventus.

Inter went into the game with a 100 per cent record in Serie A but were overwhelmed by a slick Juventus side, who ran out 2-1 winners after a late goal from substitute Gonzalo Higuain.

While Icardi is now enjoying a new lease of life with Paris Saint-Germain, Nara confirmed the family did watch the Serie A showpiece at home, realising how much Inter are missing in attack since his departure.

Inter Milan needed Mauro Icardi in the defeat to Juventus, according to his wife Wanda Nara

Antonio Conte's side struggled to generate fluency with Romelu Lukaku (left) leading attacks

'We watched Inter-Juventus, of course,' Nara told TV show Tiki Taka. 'In the first half, it seemed that Inter needed to do more.

'He didn't miss the game, but you missed him. You've missed him in the league and also the Champions League. Mauro's scored eight goals in 11 matches against Juventus.'

Icardi had a history of being prolific against rivals Juventus but he was shipped out to make room for Romelu Lukaku this summer.

Lukaku struggled badly in his first Derby D'Italia while strike partner Lautaro Martinez got Inter's only goal in the 2-1 defeat.

Since joining PSG, Icardi has scored two goals, including a vital winner in a slender 1-0 Champions League win away against Galatasaray.

Nara (middle) took the chance to aim the pointed dig at Inter by claiming they 'miss' Icardi
description: While Mauro Icardi is now enjoying a new lease of life in France with Paris Saint-Germain, wife and agent Wanda Nara confirmed the family did watch the Serie A showpiece at home.
